entry.name: ZertoAppliance_Datastores
entry.technology:
Device Properties:
zertoappliance.host -- Optional, defaults to the device IP when not set. zertoappliance.port -- Optional, defaults to 443 (Linux), set 9669 for Windows appliances. zertoappliance.user -- The user name (in the UPN or NetBIOS form as necessary), used with the Windows appliance. zertoappliance.pass -- The user password, used with the Windows appliance. zertoappliance.api.id -- The client ID, used with the Linux appliance. zertoappliance.api.key -- The client secret, used with the Linux appliance. zertoappliance.type -- Optional, forces the appliance type if required, set either "windows" or "linux". system.categories -- Add "ZertoAppliance".
Notes:
Requires access to the API endpoint on the ZVM or ZCM appliance. See the "ZertoAppliance_Token" DataSource for details.
This DataSource is not applicable when using a Zerto Cloud Manager (ZCM).
Datapoints with the suffix "Alert" will only alert where a datastore has recovery or journal data present. Zerto Appliances show all datastores that are present in the environment being protected/recovered to, not all are relevant to Zerto replication.

attribute.name: scriptgroovy

datapoint.name: AvailabilityStatus
datapoint.description:
The datastore availability status.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=EnteringMaintenance 2=InMaintenance 3=Unavailable

datapoint.name: CapacityBytes
datapoint.description: The capacity of the datastore, in bytes.

datapoint.name: FreeSpaceBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of free space of the datastore, in bytes.

datapoint.name: HealthStatus
datapoint.description:
The status of the datastore.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=NotApplicable 2=Warning 3=Error

datapoint.name: IncomingVmCount
datapoint.description: The number of virtual machines to be recovered using the datastore.

datapoint.name: OutgoingVmCount
datapoint.description: The number of virtual machines to be protected using the datastore.

datapoint.name: ProvisionedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of provisioned space of the datastore, in bytes.

datapoint.name: UsedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of used space of the datastore, in bytes.

datapoint.name: VraCount
datapoint.description: The number of VRAs using the datastore.

datapoint.name: CapacityGB
datapoint.description: The capacity of the datastore, in gigabytes.

datapoint.name: FreeSpaceGB
datapoint.description: The amount of free space of the datastore, in gigabytes.

datapoint.name: ProvisionedSizeGB
datapoint.description: The amount of provisioned space of the datastore, in gigabytes.

datapoint.name: UsedPercent
datapoint.alertbody:
The datastore ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## has ##VALUE## percent of the space used. Zerto replication may pause if the datastore is filled.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description: The percentage of used space of the datastore.

datapoint.name: UsedSizeGB
datapoint.description: The amount of used space of the datastore, in gigabytes.

datapoint.name: AppliancesProvisionedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of provisioned space of the appliances’ volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: AppliancesUsedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of used space of the appliances’ volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: JournalProvisionedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of provisioned space of the journal’s volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: JournalUsedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of used space of the journal’s volumes used size in bytes.

datapoint.name: ProtectedProvisionedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of provisioned space of the protected volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: ProtectedUsedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of used space of the protected volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: RecoveryProvisionedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of provisioned space of the recovery volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: RecoveryUsedSizeBytes
datapoint.description: The amount of used space of the recovery volumes, in bytes.

datapoint.name: UsedPercentAlert
datapoint.postprocessorparam: if(un(CapacityBytes), unkn(), if(or(gt(RecoveryUsedSizeBytes, 0), gt(JournalUsedSizeBytes, 0)), 100 * (CapacityBytes - FreeSpaceBytes) / CapacityBytes, 0))
datapoint.alertbody:
The datastore ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## has ##VALUE## percent of the space used. This datastore has Zerto recovery and/or journal data present, replication will pause if the datastore is filled.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description: Returns used percentage only where a datastore has recovery or journal data present.

datapoint.name: AvailabilityStatusAlert
datapoint.alertbody:
The datastore ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is reporting an availability status code of ##VALUE##. This datastore has Zerto recovery and/or journal data present.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=EnteringMaintenance 2=InMaintenance 3=Unavailable
datapoint.description:
Returns a status code above Normal only where a datastore has recovery or journal data present.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=EnteringMaintenance 2=InMaintenance 3=Unavailable

datapoint.name: HealthStatusAlert
datapoint.alertbody:
The datastore ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is reporting a health status code of ##VALUE##. This datastore has Zerto recovery and/or journal data present.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=NotApplicable 2=Warning 3=Error
datapoint.description:
Returns a status code above Normal only where a datastore has recovery or journal data present.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=NotApplicable 2=Warning 3=Error
